actions.committee: Senate Committee on Rules and Administration
actions.text: Referred to Senate Committee on Rules and Administration.
Reported to Senate from the Committee on Rules and Administration with amendment, S. Rept. 95-105.
Placed on calendar in Senate under Measures Cleared to be Considered by Unanimous Consent.
Measure called up by unanimous consent in Senate.

official_title: A resolution relating to Common Cause against Bailar et. al.

summary.text: (Reported to Senate from the Committee on Rules and Administration with amendment, S. Rept. 95-105) Authorizes counsel for the subpoenaed Senate employees with respect to subpoenas issued by the United States District Court for the District of Columbia in the case of Common Cause, et al. against Benjamin Bailar, et al., to furnish the following information for in camera inspection: (1) the volume of mail for 1972 with the identity of the Senators coded; (2) copies of computer code counts; and (3) affidavits concerning the meaning and use of the code.

titles.title: A resolution relating to Common Cause against Bailar et. al.
